boardgame.description: With elegantly simple gameplay, Ticket to Ride can be learned in under 15 minutes, while providing players with intense strategic and tactical decisions every turn. Players collect cards of various types of train cars they then use to claim railway routes in North America. The longer the routes, the more points they earn. Additional points come to those who fulfill Destination Tickets _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; goal cards that connect distant cities; and to the player who builds the longest continuous route._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;The rules are simple enough to write on a train ticket _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; each turn you either draw more cards, claim a route, or get additional Destination Tickets,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; says Ticket to Ride author, Alan R. Moon. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;The tension comes from being forced to balance greed _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; adding more cards to your hand, and fear _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; losing a critical route to a competitor._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Ticket to Ride continues in the tradition of Days of Wonder's big format board games featuring high-quality illustrations and components including: an oversize board map of North America, 225 custom-molded train cars, 144 illustrated cards, and wooden scoring markers._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Since its introduction and numerous subsequent awards, Ticket to Ride has become the BoardGameGeek epitome of a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;gateway game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; -- simple enough to be taught in a few minutes, and with enough action and tension to keep new players involved and in the game for the duration._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Part of the Ticket to Ride series._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

We are offering 1 unopened Ticket to Ride the Board Game.Ticket to Ride, a cross country train adventure. Its October 2, 1900 28 years ago to the day that Phileas Fogg went around the world in 80 days. Now your task is to ride across North America in just 7 days. Waiting for you is a million dollar prize, can you do it?. Lets find out. This game is for 2-5 players aged 8 and up and lasts about 30-60 minutes per game. The game is factory sealed. The game is live and ready to ship. The winner will pay $8 for shipping and insurance. Shipping is $22 to AK or HI. We will accept paypal or money order for this auction. Please e-mail us with any questions or international shipping rates. Bid with confidence, our feedback is excellent.

Days of Wonder (DOW 7201) TICKET TO RIDE October 2, 1900 - 28 years to the day that noted London eccentric, Phileas Fogg accepted and then won a £20,000 bet that he could travel _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Around the World in 80 Days_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. Now at the dawn of the century it was time for a new _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;impossible journey_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. Some old friends have gathered to celebrate Fogg_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s impetuous and lucrative gamble - and to propose a new wager of their own. The stakes: $1 Million in a winner-takes-all competition. The objective: to see which of them can travel by rail to the most cities in North America - in just 7 days. The journey begins immediately... Ticket to Ride is a cross-country train adventure where players collect cards of various types of train cars that enable them to claim railway routes connecting cities throughout North America.

Days of Wonder - Ticket To Ride Language: Dutch Players: 2 to 5 Weight: 1.300 kg New - mint condition - unopened - still in shrink wrap. Theme: With elegantly simple gameplay, Ticket to Ride can be learned in 3 minutes, while providing players with intense strategic and tactical decisions every turn. Players collect cards of various types of train cars they then use to claim railway routes in North America. The longer the routes, the more points they earn. Additional points come to those who fulfill Destination Tickets – goal cards that connect distant cities; and to the player who builds the longest continuous route. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;The rules are simple enough to write on a train ticket – each turn you either draw more cards, claim a route, or get additional Destination Tickets,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; says Ticket to Ride author, Alan R. Moon. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;The tension comes from being forced to balance greed – adding more cards to your hand, and fear – losing a critical route to a competitor._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Ticket to Ride continues in the tradition of Days of Wonder_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s big format board games featuring high-quality illustrations and components including: an oversize board map of North America, 225 custom-molded train cars, 144 illustrated cards, and wooden scoring markers.
